intro: Mariscus decaryi var. pauciflorus, commonly known as the Decary's spurge, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically features succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
